subject: Critical Thinking
title: Loss Aversion: Losses Hurt Twice as Much
description: One-minute skill: Loss Aversion: Losses Hurt Twice as Much.

hook.text: Losing $100 feels about twice as painful as gaining $100 feels good. Same money, very different emotions.

buildup.text: Loss aversion: people feel losses roughly 2x more intensely than equivalent gains.

discovery.text: This is why people hold losing stocks too long and sell winners too soon.

twist.text: Insurance companies exploit this: they sell protection against small losses you could easily afford.

climax.text: Loss aversion makes people irrationally conservative. They avoid risks that are mathematically in their favor.

punchline.text: We don't play to win. We play not to lose.

quiz.question: How much more intensely do people feel losses compared to equivalent gains?
